TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/TreeView/Glyph extends System.Object
public: ref class VisualStyleElement::TreeView::Glyph abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides objects for the plus sign (+) and minus sign (-) buttons of a tree view control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.TreeView.Glyph> class get a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for the plus sign and minus sign buttons that display next to a tree view node that contains child elements.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.TreeView.Glyph.Opened%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementTreeViewGlyph1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#320](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/CS/Form1.cs#320)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#320](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/VB/Form1.vb#320)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Closed As VisualStyleElement

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a minus sign (-) button of a tree view node.
Docs.value: A that represents a minus sign button of a tree view node.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.TreeView.Glyph.Closed%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.TreeView.Glyph.Closed%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementTreeViewGlyph2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#321](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/CS/Form1.cs#321)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#321](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/VB/Form1.vb#321)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Opened As VisualStyleElement

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a plus sign (+) button of a tree view node.
Docs.value: A that represents a plus sign button of a tree view node.

remarks.format:
